location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Henry Moore, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter is mostly an update on the expedition against Carrack [Kharg], covering several subjects:a boat delivering a packet from George Skipp in Shiraz to Basra was driven ashore at Bunderick [Bandar Rig] by Meer Mahanna's [Mīr Muhanna] armed trankeys;the order from the Caun [Karim Khan] for the Chaub [Banu Ka‘b] and other sheikhs along the Gulf coast to assist against Mīr Muhanna;reports that an English vessel has been taken off Halela [Heleylah] by the Mīr's boats;a request for more cash;whether to pay John Yoakly Botham for his normal duties while he is away with the expedition;assurances that they are ready to withdraw from Bushire necessary.
